meanings.definition: Items that do not decay or spoil
meanings.sent1: I always keep a stock of imperishables like canned goods in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had a special section for imperishables like rice and pasta.
meanings.sent3: The imperishables in the pantry were the only things left after the power outage spoiled all the fresh food.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like imperishables, enduring and unchanging through all trials.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with imperishables, ensuring the pirate's wealth would last for generations.

meanings.definition: Things that are not subject to destruction or deterioration
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was made of imperishables, standing the test of time.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of a fountain of youth that grants immortality through consuming imperishables.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was made of imperishables, making it indestructible in battle.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like imperishables, unbreakable and everlasting.
meanings.sent5: The castle was built with imperishables, ensuring it would remain majestic for centuries to come.
